channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Massive pothole in middle of road .repair from 1 month failed already .pothole is increasing in size everday, 18th January
item.description:
Opposite gates to community centre on vicarge lane brockworth What 3 words - crumble.waistcoat.yawned
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vicarage Lane, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Minibus parking and ruining the grass, 18th January
item.description:
There is a local church which has been using the grass verge as a parking spot for months. The bus is never parked particularly considerately and is causing an inconvenience on a daily basis. When the bus does which is around once a week the tyres spin which is causing the grass to be churned up which is making what is a lovely patch of green space sour to look at. This bus being parked does also raise the question of what will happen in the summer months when the grass starts getting mowed again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vervain Close, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two 25 cm diam holes close together at entrance to No 14 Greenhills Road, 18th January
item.description:
A patch repair of the large 8 cm deep pothole was done at 23:00 on 15 January. The workmen refused to fill the two 6 cm holes just behind. These need filling as cars are crashing into ever widening holes. Als the patch repair had too little tarmac inserted so already it is concave causing car tyres to slam in to it. Tyres and wheels have been damaged and one cyclist went over his handlebars into the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Greenhills Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All along the length of Cold Pool lane the Verge is degraded due traffic, 18th January
item.description:
This narrow lane which is used by large vans and lorries has degraded verges caused by vehicles being forced off the carriageway by oncoming traffic .’ This is a repeating problem which is very bad at this time, I have just had to replace two tyres and have two wheels repaired (cost over £350)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cold Pool Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water streaming across A40- ice hazard, 18th January
item.description:
Water streaming continuously across A40 near Woodbank House from South to North since December. Rain makes it worse. Will be a real ice hazard in freezing conditions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 18th January
item.description:
At the end of the right hand lane, where the slip road joins the roundabout, there is a pothole at the end of the carriageway. Looking at the reporting history for the location, this was originally reported in 2024 but has never been repaired and is getting consistently worse. I have incurred burst tyres from it on 2 occasions now
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Golden Valley Junction, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive breakdown in road structure, 18th January
item.description:
The road from Withington to Coberley at Holcomb by Hilcot Brook has completely broken down and the giant pothole simply fills with water. Very difficult in a small car.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold
